revised_title: Physics and Applications of Thermotropic Liquid Crystals: A Review of Nematic Order Theories
tldr: This article reviews the theories of nematic order in thermotropic liquid crystals, focusing on molecular alignment and correlations. It discusses the Maier-Saupe approach, mean field theories, and the limitations of these theories in explaining the behavior of real nematic materials. The author also highlights the importance of director fluctuations and the range of molecular correlations in nematic liquids.
